It now says it is âreviewing its relationsâ with the country. - Russian President Vladimir Putin, a Lukashenko ally, said last week in a meeting between the two men that Moscow would extend a $1.5 billion loan to its cash-strapped neighbor, after indicating earlier that a Russian police force was ready to help the regime if protests got out of control. - European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen cautioned a week ago in her âstate of the unionâ address to the European Parliament that âthose that advocate closer ties with Russiaâ are wrong. âThe poisoning of Alexei Navalny with an advanced chemical agent is not a one off. We have seen the pattern in Georgia and Ukraine, Syria and Salisbury â and in election meddling around the world. This pattern is not changing â and no pipeline will change that,â she said.
